test_cases.Title: FirstLine_proj_001_DisplayOfFirstLineRequirement_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Expected Result: The application starts successfully without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the main screen or the relevant section where the 'first line' should be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: The main screen or relevant section loads correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'first line' is present and visible at the top of the designated area.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'first line' is clearly visible at the top of the designated area.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The desktop application is installed on the computer.
2. The user has access rights to launch the application.
3. The system is connected to the required network (if applicable).

test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the display of the first line on desktop interface.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoad-ZENIT_RF001_DataMigration_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the legacy data source is available and accessible.
Steps.Expected Result: Legacy data source is reachable and data is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the initial load and data migration process from the legacy system to ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Data migration process starts without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process for completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration process completes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all expected data records are present in the ZENIT system post-migration.
Steps.Expected Result: All data records are accurately migrated and available in ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Check for data integrity by comparing sample records between source and target systems.
Steps.Expected Result: Sample records match exactly between source and target.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Legacy data source is populated and accessible. 2. ZENIT system is installed and configured. 3. User has admin privileges to perform migration.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample legacy data set for migration.
test_cases.Expected Result: All legacy data is migrated to ZENIT without loss or corruption, and data integrity is maintained.

test_cases.Title: SessionTimeout-ZENIT_RF002_DisconnectedInactivity_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application as a valid user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive for the configured inactivity timeout period (e.g., 15 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected during this period.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application behavior after the timeout period elapses.
Steps.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out and redirected to the login page with an inactivity message.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. ZENIT application is running. 2. User credentials are available. 3. Inactivity timeout is configured (e.g., 15 minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: User session is terminated after inactivity and user is prompted to log in again.

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-ZENIT_RF003_LoginSOX_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application with a valid user account.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and login event is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit/log tracking system or database.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/log system is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the login event corresponding to the user and timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: Login event is recorded with correct user ID, timestamp, and relevant metadata.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. ZENIT application is running. 2. Audit/log tracking system is enabled. 3. User credentials are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each login event is properly tracked and recorded for SOX compliance.

test_cases.Title: LogTracking-ZENIT_RF004_OperationAudit_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Perform a set of operations in the ZENIT application (e.g., data update, deletion).
Steps.Expected Result: Operations are executed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Access the log tracking/audit system.
Steps.Expected Result: Log tracking system is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each operation is logged with correct details (user, operation type, timestamp, affected data).
Steps.Expected Result: All operations are accurately logged with complete details.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. ZENIT application is running. 2. Log tracking/audit system is enabled. 3. User credentials are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; sample data for operations.
test_cases.Expected Result: All user operations are logged for audit and traceability purposes.

test_cases.Title: Concurrency-ZENIT_RF005_ManageConcurrency_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application with two different user accounts on separate devices or browsers.
Steps.Expected Result: Both users are logged in successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to edit the same data record simultaneously from both sessions.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects concurrent modification attempts.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application response for both users.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents data corruption by allowing only one user to save changes, or prompts for conflict resolution.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. ZENIT application is running. 2. Two valid user accounts are available. 3. Target data record exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Two valid user credentials; target data record.
test_cases.Expected Result: System manages concurrent data access and prevents data loss or corruption.

test_cases.Title: Settings-ZENIT_RF006_UserPreferences_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application as a valid user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the settings/preferences section.
Steps.Expected Result: Settings page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Modify a user preference (e.g., language, notification settings) and save changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Preference is updated and saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in to verify persistence of the updated setting.
Steps.Expected Result: Updated preference is retained after re-login.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. ZENIT application is running. 2. User credentials are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: User preferences can be updated and persist across sessions.

test_cases.Title: Verify-proj_001_introduction_document_translation_functionality/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Obtain the user requirements document as input.
Steps.Expected Result: User requirements document is available for processing.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the translation process to convert user requirements into functional specifications.
Steps.Expected Result: Translation process starts without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Review the generated functional specifications document.
Steps.Expected Result: Functional specifications document is generated.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the content of the functional specifications with the original user requirements to ensure all requirements are covered and accurately translated.
Steps.Expected Result: All user requirements are present and correctly reflected in the functional specifications.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User requirements document is finalized and available.
2. Translation tool or process is accessible.
3. Tester has access to both documents.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample user requirements document; access to translation tool/process.
test_cases.Expected Result: Functional specifications document accurately reflects all user requirements as per the input document.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers the translation process from user requirements to functional specifications.

test_cases.Title: Verify-proj_001_introduction_document_translation_error_handling/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to initiate the translation process with an incomplete or missing user requirements document.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the missing or incomplete document and displays an appropriate error message.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to the error condition.
Steps.Expected Result: Translation process does not proceed, and user is informed of the issue.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Translation tool or process is accessible.
2. No valid user requirements document is provided or the document is incomplete.
test_cases.Dataset: No or incomplete user requirements document.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents translation and provides a clear error message when input is missing or incomplete.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for missing or incomplete input documents.

test_cases.Title: Verify-proj_001_introduction_document_translation_completeness/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Provide a user requirements document containing edge cases (e.g., ambiguous, conflicting, or incomplete requirements).
Steps.Expected Result: User requirements document with edge cases is available for processing.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the translation process to generate functional specifications.
Steps.Expected Result: Translation process completes without system errors.

Steps.Step Description: Review the generated functional specifications for handling of edge cases.
Steps.Expected Result: Functional specifications document addresses ambiguities, conflicts, or incomplete requirements appropriately (e.g., with notes, clarifications, or flags for further review).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User requirements document with edge cases is available.
2. Translation tool or process is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: User requirements document with ambiguous, conflicting, or incomplete requirements.
test_cases.Expected Result: Functional specifications document highlights or addresses all edge cases from the user requirements document.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers completeness and handling of edge cases in the translation process.

test_cases.Title: CreditStatusVisibility-proj1_req1_CustomerCreditStatus_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Customer Credit Status' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The section loads, displaying a list of all retail customers (points of sale).

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific point of sale from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: Detailed credit status for the selected point of sale is displayed, including credit limit, current exposure, and available credit.

Steps.Step Description: Drill down into business areas for the selected point of sale.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays credit status broken down by business area (e.g., product lines, channels).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. At least one point of sale with credit data exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; at least one point of sale with credit data.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view comprehensive credit status for any point of sale, with drill-down into all business areas.

test_cases.Title: RiskSummary-proj1_req2_CompanyRiskSummary_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Company Risk Summary' dashboard or section.
Steps.Expected Result: A summary view of the company's overall risk level is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Review the risk indicators and summary metrics.
Steps.Expected Result: Risk indicators (e.g., total exposure, risk by channel, risk by product) are visible and up-to-date.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. Risk data is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; risk data for company.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view an accurate and up-to-date summary of the company's risk level.

test_cases.Title: CreditLineDrilldown-proj1_req3_CreditLineBreakdown_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Line Management' section.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of all points of sale and their credit lines is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a point of sale and view its credit line details.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit lines are displayed, broken down by product (e.g., Totocalcio, Horse Racing, etc.).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the breakdown matches the expected categories for the selected point of sale (SIMP or GEO products).
Steps.Expected Result: Credit line breakdown is accurate and reflects the correct products for the selected point of sale.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. At least one point of sale with multiple product credit lines exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; point of sale with SIMP and GEO product credit lines.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view a detailed, accurate breakdown of credit lines by product for each point of sale.

test_cases.Title: ChannelClassification-proj1_req4_ChannelCategoryAssignment_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Points of Sale' management section.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of all points of sale is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a point of sale and view its details, including 'Canale 1' category.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Canale 1' category is displayed for the selected point of sale.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Canale 1' value matches the expected mapping based on the 'Cluster PV' (e.g., PGI, PGS, Negozio, etc.).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Canale 1' value is correctly assigned as BRANDED or UNBRANDED according to the mapping rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. Points of sale with various 'Cluster PV' values exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; points of sale with different 'Cluster PV' values.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each point of sale is correctly classified as BRANDED or UNBRANDED based on the 'Cluster PV' value.

test_cases.Title: CreditLineProductList-proj1_req5_CreditLineProducts_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Line Products' section.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of all available credit line products is displayed, separated by SIMP and GEO.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the SIMP products include Totocalcio, Horse Racing, Fixed Odds Sports, Virtual Race, and Global Game.
Steps.Expected Result: All SIMP products are listed as available credit lines.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the GEO products include Numerical Games (GNTN), Corner (PGI and PGS), and Game Accounts (Servizi - CONTI GIOCO).
Steps.Expected Result: All GEO products are listed as available credit lines.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system displays all available credit line products for SIMP and GEO as specified.

test_cases.Title: WeeklyCreditLineManagement-proj1_req6_WeeklyCreditLineUpdate_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Line Management' section.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of all points of sale and their credit lines is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a point of sale and view its credit line management history.
Steps.Expected Result: A history of credit line changes is displayed, showing updates on a weekly basis.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that credit line updates are only allowed or reflected on a weekly basis.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit line management actions are restricted to weekly intervals, and the system enforces this rule.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. At least one point of sale with credit line management history exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; point of sale with credit line management history.
test_cases.Expected Result: Credit line management for each product is performed and tracked on a weekly basis only.

test_cases.Title: MDMIntegration-proj_001_MDM_MasterDataSync_ZENIT_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure MDM system contains updated PoS master data for all countries.
Steps.Expected Result: MDM system has the latest PoS master data available.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the synchronization process between MDM and ZENIT via ESB.
Steps.Expected Result: Synchronization process initiates without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT receives and updates PoS master data from MDM via ESB.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT reflects the latest PoS master data as provided by MDM.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. MDM system is operational and contains valid PoS master data.
2. ESB is configured and operational.
3. ZENIT is connected to ESB and ready to receive data.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS master data in MDM for multiple countries.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT successfully receives and updates PoS master data from MDM via ESB without data loss or corruption.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the data synchronization aspect, not error handling or incremental updates.

test_cases.Title: ORIONIntegration-proj_001_TerminalsProductsDataSync_ZENIT_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure ORION system contains updated PoS terminals and products data.
Steps.Expected Result: ORION system has the latest terminals and products data available.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data synchronization process between ORION and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Synchronization process starts successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT receives and updates PoS terminals and products data from ORION.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT displays the latest terminals and products data as provided by ORION.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ORION system is operational and contains valid terminals and products data.
2. ZENIT is configured to receive data from ORION.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample terminals and products data in ORION.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT successfully receives and updates PoS terminals and products data from ORION.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover error scenarios or partial data updates.

test_cases.Title: CERVEDIntegration-proj_001_RiskAnalysisRatingSync_ZENIT_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure CERVED system contains up-to-date PoS commercial information and ratings.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentUpdate_proj_RF005_DataConsistency_UpdateRecord_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the record management page.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same record management page as User A.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User A opens Record X for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: Record X is displayed in edit mode for User A.

Steps.Step Description: User B opens Record X for editing at the same time.
Steps.Expected Result: Record X is displayed in edit mode for User B.

Steps.Step Description: User A updates a field in Record X and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User A receives a confirmation that the changes have been saved.

Steps.Step Description: User B, without refreshing, updates a different field in Record X and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the concurrent modification and either merges changes, prompts User B about the conflict, or prevents the overwrite, ensuring data consistency.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access to the system.
2. Record X exists in the database.
3. Both users are logged in and have access to the record management page.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record X with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system maintains data consistency and prevents data loss or corruption when multiple users attempt to update the same record concurrently.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent update scenario for a single record.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentReadWrite_proj_RF005_DataConsistency_ReadDuringWrite_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the record management page.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same record management page as User A.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User A opens Record Y for editing and starts making changes but does not save yet.
Steps.Expected Result: Record Y is displayed in edit mode for User A.

Steps.Step Description: User B views Record Y in read-only mode while User A is editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the current (pre-edit) values of Record Y.

Steps.Step Description: User A saves the changes to Record Y.
Steps.Expected Result: User A receives a confirmation that the changes have been saved.

Steps.Step Description: User B refreshes the view of Record Y.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the updated values of Record Y after User A's changes.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access to the system.
2. Record Y exists in the database.
3. Both users are logged in and have access to the record management page.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record Y with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system ensures that users viewing a record see consistent data and are updated with the latest changes after a save operation.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers read consistency during concurrent write operations.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentDelete_proj_RF005_DataConsistency_DeleteWhileEdit_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the record management page.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same record management page as User A.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same record management page.

Steps.Step Description: User A opens Record Z for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: Record Z is displayed in edit mode for User A.

Steps.Step Description: User B deletes Record Z while User A is editing it.
Steps.Expected Result: User B receives confirmation that Record Z has been deleted.

Steps.Step Description: User A attempts to save changes to Record Z after it has been deleted by User B.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents the save operation and notifies User A that Record Z no longer exists.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access to the system.
2. Record Z exists in the database.
3. Both users are logged in and have access to the record management page.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record Z with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents updates to records that have been deleted by another user, ensuring data consistency and proper user notification.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent delete and edit scenario.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentBulkUpdate_proj_RF005_DataConsistency_BulkUpdate_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the bulk update page.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the bulk update page.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same bulk update page.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the bulk update page.

Steps.Step Description: User A selects multiple records (e.g., Records 1-10) and initiates a bulk update operation.

Steps.Step Description: User B selects an overlapping set of records (e.g., Records 5-15) and initiates a bulk update operation simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: User B's bulk update operation is initiated.

Steps.Step Description: Both bulk update operations complete.
Steps.Expected Result: The system ensures that all records are updated consistently, with no data loss or corruption, and any conflicts are resolved according to business rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access to the system.
2. Records 1-15 exist in the database.
3. Both users are logged in and have access to the bulk update page.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Records 1-15 with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system maintains data consistency and resolves conflicts when multiple users perform overlapping bulk updates concurrently.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent bulk update scenario with overlapping records.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentSession_proj_RF005_SessionIsolation_MultipleSessions_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system from Computer 1.

Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully logs in from Computer 2.

test_cases.Title: NoDocuments-proj_RF008_Dashboard_NoDocumentsScenario_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the dashboard application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a POS from the list that has no associated documents from either Cerved or ARXivar.
Steps.Expected Result: The POS is selected and its details are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section for the selected POS.
Steps.Expected Result: A dedicated section for documents is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the message or content displayed in the 'Documents' section.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is shown indicating that no documents are available for the selected POS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one POS exists with no associated documents from Cerved or ARXivar.
3. The dashboard application is accessible from a desktop environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, POS with no associated documents.
test_cases.Expected Result: A clear message is displayed indicating that no documents are available for the selected POS.

test_cases.Title: DocumentOrigin-proj_RF008_Dashboard_DocumentOriginDisplay_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the dashboard application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a POS from the list that has documents from both Cerved and ARXivar.
Steps.Expected Result: The POS is selected and its details are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section for the selected POS.
Steps.Expected Result: A dedicated section for documents is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check the list of documents for an indication of their origin (Cerved or ARXivar).
Steps.Expected Result: Each document in the list clearly indicates its origin (Cerved or ARXivar).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one POS exists with documents from both Cerved and ARXivar.
3. The dashboard application is accessible from a desktop environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, POS with documents from both Cerved and ARXivar.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each document in the list displays its origin (Cerved or ARXivar) clearly.

test_cases.Title: AccessDenied-proj_RF008_Dashboard_UnauthorizedAccessDocuments_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the dashboard application with a user account that does not have permission to view POS documents.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to the dashboard or the 'Documents' section is denied.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error or warning message displayed to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear and informative error message is displayed indicating insufficient permissions.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with restricted permissions (no access to POS documents).
2. The dashboard application is accessible from a desktop environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with restricted access.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is prevented from accessing the 'Documents' section and receives an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Title: DocumentRefresh-proj_RF008_Dashboard_RefreshDocumentList_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the dashboard application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a POS from the list that has associated documents.
Steps.Expected Result: The POS is selected and its details are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section for the selected POS.
Steps.Expected Result: A dedicated section for documents is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a refresh action (e.g., click a 'Refresh' button) in the 'Documents' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of documents is updated to reflect the latest documents from both Cerved and ARXivar.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one POS exists with documents from Cerved and/or ARXivar.
3. The dashboard application is accessible from a desktop environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, POS with documents from Cerved and/or ARXivar.
test_cases.Expected Result: The document list is refreshed and displays the most up-to-date documents from both sources.

test_cases.Title: ViewBordero-proj_RF009_Dashboard_OpenArchiCONLink_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the system with valid credentials and access the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS entry that has an associated Border document.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS entry is visible and indicates the presence of a Border document.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the ArchiCON link or icon associated with the selected PoS from the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: A new browser tab or window opens, displaying the Border document in ArchiCON for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS with an associated Border document exists in the system.
3. User is logged in and on the dashboard page.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with associated Border document.
test_cases.Expected Result: The Border document for the selected PoS is displayed in ArchiCON when accessed from the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: ViewBordero-proj_RF009_Dashboard_OpenArchiCONLink_NoDocument_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the system with valid credentials and access the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS entry that does NOT have an associated Border document.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS entry is visible and indicates the absence of a Border document or the ArchiCON link is disabled/not present.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click on the ArchiCON link or icon for the PoS without a Border document (if present).
Steps.Expected Result: No action occurs, or an appropriate message is displayed indicating that no Border document is available.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS without an associated Border document exists in the system.
3. User is logged in and on the dashboard page.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS without associated Border document.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents access to ArchiCON or displays a message indicating no Border document is available for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: ViewBordero-proj_RF009_Dashboard_OpenArchiCONLink_InvalidSession_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the system and access the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Let the session expire or manually log out without closing the dashboard page.
Steps.Expected Result: Session is invalidated; user is technically logged out.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click on the ArchiCON link for a PoS with an associated Border document.
Steps.Expected Result: System prompts the user to log in again or displays a session timeout message before allowing access to ArchiCON.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS with an associated Border document exists in the system.
3. User session is expired or user is logged out while dashboard is still open.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with associated Border document.
test_cases.Expected Result: System does not allow access to ArchiCON and prompts for re-authentication if the session is invalid.

test_cases.Title: ViewBordero-proj_RF009_Dashboard_OpenArchiCONLink_MultiplePoS_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the system and access the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Identify multiple PoS entries, each with an associated Border document.
Steps.Expected Result: Multiple PoS entries with ArchiCON links are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the ArchiCON link for each PoS, one after another.
Steps.Expected Result: Each click opens the corresponding Border document in ArchiCON, each in a new tab or window.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. Multiple PoS with associated Border documents exist in the system.
3. User is logged in and on the dashboard page.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Multiple PoS with associated Border documents.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each Border document is correctly displayed in ArchiCON for the respective PoS when accessed from the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: ViewNotes-proj_RF010_Dashboard_ViewNotes_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the dashboard list.
Steps.Expected Result: Details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate and click on the 'Notes' section/tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Existing notes for the selected PoS are displayed, if any.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, at least one PoS with and without existing notes.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can view all existing notes for the selected PoS from the dashboard.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the viewing of notes, not note creation or editing.

test_cases.Title: AddNote-proj_RF010_Dashboard_AddNote_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the dashboard list.
Steps.Expected Result: Details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Notes' section/tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the option to add a new note.
Steps.Expected Result: A form or input field for entering a new note is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter note details (e.g., '2024-06-10, John Doe, Credit increased by 500').
Steps.Expected Result: Note details are entered into the input field.

Steps.Step Description: Save or submit the new note.
Steps.Expected Result: The new note is saved and displayed in the notes list for the PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, at least one PoS, sample note data (date, name, note content).
test_cases.Expected Result: User can successfully add a new note to the selected PoS, and the note is visible in the notes list.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the addition of notes, not editing or deleting.

test_cases.Title: AddNoteInvalidData-proj_RF010_Dashboard_AddNoteInvalidData_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the dashboard list.
Steps.Expected Result: Details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Notes' section/tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the option to add a new note.
Steps.Expected Result: A form or input field for entering a new note is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the note details field empty or enter only whitespace.
Steps.Expected Result: Note input field remains empty or contains only whitespace.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save or submit the empty note.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message indicating that note content is required and does not save the note.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the dashboard.
2. At least one PoS is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents saving empty notes and displays an appropriate error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers validation for empty note input.

test_cases.Title: ViewNotesMobile-proj_RF010_Dashboard_ViewNotes_TEST_Android

Steps.Step Description: Open the mobile app and log in with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with a list of available PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Tap on a specific PoS from the dashboard list.
Steps.Expected Result: Details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Notes' section/tab for the selected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Existing notes for the selected PoS are displayed, if any.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the mobile app.
2. At least one PoS is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, at least one PoS with and without existing notes.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can view all existing notes for the selected PoS from the dashboard on Android devices.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the viewing of notes on Android mobile devices.

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportValidRedListFile_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT backoffice system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the RedList import section within the application.
Steps.Expected Result: RedList import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Import RedList' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload dialog is presented to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Select a valid 'RedList_Mm_yyyy.xlsx' file containing all required columns (IdRice, Zona Rice, Flag RedList, General Reason, SIMP Management, SIMP Reason) and upload it.
Steps.Expected Result: File is uploaded and processed without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the import action if prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms successful import and displays a summary of imported records.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials with permission to import RedList data.
2. ZENIT backoffice system is accessible.
3. A valid RedList Excel file ('RedList_Mm_yyyy.xlsx') is available on the local machine.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid RedList Excel file with all required columns and sample data.
test_cases.Expected Result: RedList data from the Excel file is correctly imported into the system, and a success message is displayed.

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportRedListFileWithMissingColumns_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT backoffice system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the RedList import section within the application.
Steps.Expected Result: RedList import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Import RedList' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload dialog is presented to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Select an Excel file missing one or more required columns (e.g., missing 'SIMP Reason') and upload it.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file and detects missing columns.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to the invalid file structure.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message indicating which columns are missing and prevents import.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials with permission to import RedList data.
2. ZENIT backoffice system is accessible.
3. An invalid RedList Excel file (missing required columns) is available on the local machine.
test_cases.Dataset: RedList Excel file missing one or more required columns.
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the file and provides a clear error message about missing columns.

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportRedListFileWithInvalidFlagValue_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT backoffice system with valid credentials.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the RedList import section within the application.

test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the file and provides a clear error message about invalid 'Flag RedList' values.

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportRedListFileWithEmptyMandatoryFields_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportRedListFileWithInvalidFileFormat_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT backoffice system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the RedList import section within the application.
Steps.Expected Result: RedList import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Import RedList' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload dialog is presented to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Select a file with an invalid format (e.g., .csv, .txt, .pdf) and attempt to upload it.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates the file type and detects invalid format.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to the invalid file format.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an error message indicating only .xlsx files are accepted and prevents import.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials with permission to import RedList data.
2. ZENIT backoffice system is accessible.
3. A file with an invalid format (not .xlsx) is available on the local machine.
test_cases.Dataset: File with invalid format (e.g., .csv, .txt, .pdf).
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects the file and provides a clear error message about accepted file formats.

test_cases.Title: ImportRedList-proj_RF011_ImportRedListFileWithLargeDataset_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT backoffice system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the RedList import section within the application.
Steps.Expected Result: RedList import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Import RedList' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload dialog is presented to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Select a valid 'RedList_Mm_yyyy.xlsx' file containing a large number of records (e.g., 10,000+) and upload it.
Steps.Expected Result: File is uploaded and processed without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the import action if prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms successful import and displays a summary of imported records.

test_cases.Expected Result: System successfully imports all records and provides a summary without performance degradation or errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers performance and scalability aspects of the import functionality.

test_cases.Title: LoginLogout-proj_001_Login_ValidCredentials_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Back-Office login page using a supported browser.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username and password.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials are accepted.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard/home page.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with valid credentials exists in the system.
2. Back-Office application is accessible.
3. Browser is installed and configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password (e.g., user1/password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard/home page.

test_cases.Title: LoginLogout-proj_001_Login_InvalidCredentials_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Back-Office login page using a supported browser.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid username and/or password.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials are not accepted.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User remains on the login page and an error message is displayed indicating invalid credentials.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Back-Office application is accessible.
2. Browser is installed and configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid username and/or password (e.g., user1/wrongpass)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not authenticated and receives an error message.

test_cases.Title: LoginLogout-proj_001_Logout_SessionTermination_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Back-Office application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Logout' button or link.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a protected page via browser back button or direct URL.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the login page and cannot access protected content.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged in to the Back-Office application.
2. Browser is installed and configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user session
test_cases.Expected Result: User session is terminated and protected pages are inaccessible after logout.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoad-proj_001_DataMigration_ValidFile_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a valid data migration file as per the 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' specification.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration file is ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data migration process via the backend interface or API.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the migration file.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process until completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration completes without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all records from the file are present in the target database.
Steps.Expected Result: All data is correctly migrated and available in the system.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Backend system is operational.
2. Access to backend migration interface or API is available.
3. Valid migration file is prepared as per specification.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid migration file as per 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati'
test_cases.Expected Result: All valid data is migrated successfully without errors.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoad-proj_001_DataMigration_InvalidFile_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an invalid data migration file (e.g., missing required columns, incorrect format).
Steps.Expected Result: Invalid migration file is ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data migration process via the backend interface or API.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file and detects errors.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system response to the invalid file.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays/logs appropriate error messages.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Backend system is operational.
2. Access to backend migration interface or API is available.
3. Invalid migration file is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid migration file (e.g., missing columns, wrong format)
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects invalid migration files and provides clear error messages.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_TransactionLogging_SuccessfulOperation_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Perform a transaction in the system (e.g., data update, user login).
Steps.Expected Result: Transaction is completed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log via the backend interface or database.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the transaction is recorded in the audit log with correct details (timestamp, user, action, status).
Steps.Expected Result: Transaction details are accurately recorded in the audit log.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Backend system is operational.
2. Audit logging is enabled.
3. User has permission to perform transactions and access logs.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample transaction (e.g., user login, data update)
test_cases.Expected Result: All relevant transactions are logged with correct details for audit purposes.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_TransactionLogging_FailedOperation_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform a transaction that is expected to fail (e.g., invalid data update).
Steps.Expected Result: Transaction fails as expected.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit log via the backend interface or database.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the failed transaction is recorded in the audit log with correct details (timestamp, user, action, status, error message).
Steps.Expected Result: Failed transaction details are accurately recorded in the audit log.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Backend system is operational.
2. Audit logging is enabled.
3. User has permission to perform transactions and access logs.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample failed transaction (e.g., invalid data update)
test_cases.Expected Result: All failed transactions are logged with correct details for audit purposes.

test_cases.Title: DashboardCreditMgmt-proj_001_ViewCreditLines_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Back-Office application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Credit Management section of the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Management section is displayed.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_dataMigration_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the target system is installed and configured as per deployment documentation.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process for any errors or warnings.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration process completes successfully without critical errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all expected data entities (e.g., users, transactions, configurations) are present in the target system.
Steps.Expected Result: All data entities are present and accounted for in the target system.

Steps.Step Description: Validate data integrity by comparing a sample of migrated records between source and target systems.
Steps.Expected Result: Sampled records match exactly between source and target.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Target system is installed and configured.
2. Source data backup/export is available.
3. Migration tool or script is accessible.

test_cases.Expected Result: All relevant data is migrated accurately and completely from the source to the target system, with no loss or corruption.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers standard data migration scenario, not edge or error cases.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_dataMigration_InvalidData_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process for error handling and logging.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that invalid records are not migrated to the target system.
Steps.Expected Result: Invalid records are excluded from the target system.

Steps.Step Description: Check that valid records (if any) are migrated successfully.
Steps.Expected Result: Valid records are present in the target system.

test_cases.Preconditions:

test_cases.Expected Result: The migration process should skip or reject invalid records, log errors, and migrate only valid data.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_dataMigration_InterruptedProcess_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data migration process with a standard data set.

Steps.Step Description: Intentionally interrupt the migration process (e.g., by shutting down the system or terminating the migration tool).

Steps.Step Description: Restart the migration process.
