test_cases.Title: MSTCreditLines_XPS-ZENIT-040_DataAcquisition_FieldValidationWithMissingData_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with access to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS with missing or incomplete Credit Line/Product data (e.g., missing 'Estensione Day').
Steps.Expected Result: The Credit Management tab for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the dashboard displays fields with missing data (e.g., empty, zero, error message).
Steps.Expected Result: Fields with missing data are handled gracefully (e.g., shown as empty, with a placeholder, or with a clear error message), and no system errors occur.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system is operational and connected to MST/SIMP/DWH as per configuration.
2. At least one PoS with missing or incomplete Credit Line/Product data exists.
3. User credentials with access to the dashboard are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with missing or incomplete Credit Line/Product data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard handles missing or incomplete Credit Line/Product data gracefully, without errors or misleading information.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for missing data.
test_cases._polarion: XPS-ZENIT-040 - MST Credit Lines - Data Acquisition

test_cases.Title: MSTCreditLines_XPS-ZENIT-040_DataAcquisition_InvalidDataHandling_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with access to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a PoS with invalid Credit Line/Product data (e.g., negative values, non-numeric where numeric expected).
Steps.Expected Result: The Credit Management tab for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the dashboard displays fields with invalid data.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields with invalid data are handled gracefully (e.g., shown as error, flagged, or with a clear message), and no system errors occur.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system is operational and connected to MST/SIMP/DWH as per configuration.
2. At least one PoS with invalid Credit Line/Product data exists.
3. User credentials with access to the dashboard are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with invalid Credit Line/Product data (e.g., negative or non-numeric values).
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard handles invalid Credit Line/Product data gracefully, without errors or misleading information.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for invalid data.
test_cases._polarion: XPS-ZENIT-040 - MST Credit Lines - Data Acquisition

test_cases.Title: MSTCreditLines_XPS-ZENIT-040_DataAcquisition_SourceSwitchingValidation_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Configure ZENIT to retrieve Credit Line/Product data from MST, SIMP, and DWH replica sequentially (as per technical availability).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT is configured to use the selected data source.

Steps.Step Description: For each configuration, log in to the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' tab for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The Credit Management tab for the selected PoS is displayed for each data source.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Credit Line/Product data is correctly retrieved and displayed from each source.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit Line/Product data is accurately displayed regardless of the data source (MST, SIMP, DWH replica).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system is operational and can be configured to use different data sources (MST, SIMP, DWH replica).
2. User credentials with access to the dashboard are available.
3. PoS with Credit Line/Product data present in all sources.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with Credit Line/Product data available in MST, SIMP, and DWH.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays correct Credit Line/Product data for each data source configuration.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers data source switching, not source synchronization.
test_cases._polarion: XPS-ZENIT-040 - MST Credit Lines - Data Acquisition

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DailyDataAcquisition_AutomatedDataImport_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure COMMA6 system has up-to-date AWP data for all PoS as of the previous evening.
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 contains the latest AWP data for all PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily integration process between COMMA6 and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates as scheduled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT receives and stores the following data for each PoS: IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr AWP Management IAG, Nr AWP Management NO IAG, Nr AWP Third-party IAG, Nr AWP Third-party NO IAG, Nr AWP Average, Type of Collection AWP under Management, Coin In Average AWP - YTD.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified data fields are present and populated for each PoS in ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the data snapshot in ZENIT corresponds to the previous evening's data from COMMA6.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT data matches COMMA6 data as of the previous evening for all PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. COMMA6 system is operational and contains valid, up-to-date AWP data for all PoS as of the previous evening.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured to connect to COMMA6.
3. Scheduled integration process is enabled and set to run daily.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data in COMMA6 with all required fields populated.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system automatically imports and stores all required AWP data fields for each PoS from COMMA6 on a daily basis, reflecting the previous evening's snapshot.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DashboardDataDisplay_SinglePoS_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Single PoS' view for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS view is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following data fields are displayed: IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr AWP Management IAG, Nr AWP Management NO IAG, Nr AWP Third-party IAG, Nr AWP Third-party NO IAG, Nr AWP Average, Type of Collection AWP under Management, Coin In Average AWP - YTD.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified data fields are visible and populated for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the displayed data with the latest imported data from COMMA6 (as of the previous evening).
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed data matches the imported data for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system has completed a successful daily data import from COMMA6.
2. At least one PoS exists with complete data in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Imported PoS data from COMMA6 for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS view displays all required AWP data fields accurately for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DashboardDataDisplay_ADIDataTab_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab' for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all required AWP data fields are displayed: IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr AWP Management IAG, Nr AWP Management NO IAG, Nr AWP Third-party IAG, Nr AWP Third-party NO IAG, Nr AWP Average, Type of Collection AWP under Management, Coin In Average AWP - YTD.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified data fields are visible and populated in the ADI Data Tab for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the displayed data with the latest imported data from COMMA6 (as of the previous evening).
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed data matches the imported data for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system has completed a successful daily data import from COMMA6.
2. At least one PoS exists with complete data in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Imported PoS data from COMMA6 for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab displays all required AWP data fields accurately for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DailyDataAcquisition_MissingFieldHandling_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: In COMMA6, create or modify a PoS record with one or more required AWP data fields missing (e.g., omit 'Nr AWP Management IAG').
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 contains a PoS record with incomplete data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily integration process between COMMA6 and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates as scheduled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how ZENIT handles the missing data field(s) for the affected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT logs an error or warning for the missing field(s) and either skips the record or imports available data with clear indication of missing values.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. COMMA6 system is operational and allows editing of PoS data.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for daily integration.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record in COMMA6 with one or more required fields missing.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system handles missing data fields gracefully, logs appropriate errors or warnings, and maintains data integrity for other fields.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for missing fields during data acquisition.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DailyDataAcquisition_InvalidDataHandling_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: In COMMA6, create or modify a PoS record with invalid data in one or more fields (e.g., non-numeric value in 'Nr AWP Management IAG').
Steps.Expected Result: COMMA6 contains a PoS record with invalid data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily integration process between COMMA6 and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates as scheduled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how ZENIT handles the invalid data for the affected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT logs an error or warning for the invalid data and either skips the record or imports available valid data with clear indication of invalid values.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. COMMA6 system is operational and allows editing of PoS data.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for daily integration.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record in COMMA6 with invalid data in one or more fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system handles invalid data gracefully, logs appropriate errors or warnings, and maintains data integrity for other fields.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for invalid data during data acquisition.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DailyDataAcquisition_ScheduleEnforcement_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Verify the scheduled time for the daily integration process between COMMA6 and ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Scheduled time for daily integration is documented and configured.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the scheduled time and monitor the integration process execution.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration process starts automatically at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Check ZENIT logs or dashboard to confirm that data import occurred at the correct time.
Steps.Expected Result: Logs or dashboard confirm that data import was executed at the scheduled time.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Scheduled integration time is configured in ZENIT.
2. Both COMMA6 and ZENIT systems are operational.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (relies on system configuration and logs).
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system enforces the daily integration schedule and imports data at the configured time.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers schedule enforcement for daily data acquisition.

test_cases.Title: AWP-ZENIT_050_DailyDataAcquisition_DataStorageVerification_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: After a successful daily data import, access the ZENIT data storage (database or equivalent).
Steps.Expected Result: Access to ZENIT data storage is established.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all imported AWP data for each PoS is stored with a timestamp or reference date corresponding to the previous evening.
Steps.Expected Result: Each data record is stored with the correct reference date.

Steps.Step Description: Check that historical daily data is retained for each PoS (i.e., previous days' data is not overwritten).
Steps.Expected Result: Historical daily data is available and not overwritten by new imports.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. At least one successful daily data import has occurred.
2. Access to ZENIT data storage is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Imported AWP data for multiple days for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system stores daily imported AWP data with correct reference dates and retains historical data for each PoS.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers data storage and historical retention.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-060_DailyIntegration_AutomatedUpdate_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the integration between ZENIT and NEXT VLT is configured and operational.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration is active and ready for data exchange.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily data acquisition process to run (at the expected time, e.g., after midnight).
Steps.Expected Result: The automated process initiates without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT receives a new data snapshot from NEXT VLT for all PoS for the previous day.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains updated data for all PoS, timestamped with the previous day's date.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the data for each PoS includes IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, and Nr VLT Average (YTD).
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and populated for each PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS and the ADI Data Tab for several PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The dashboard displays the latest daily data for each PoS, matching the snapshot received.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Integration between ZENIT and NEXT VLT is configured and enabled.
2. Test PoS data is available in NEXT VLT.
3. Scheduled daily job is set up in ZENIT for data acquisition.
4. Tester has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data in NEXT VLT with known values for IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average (YTD).
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system automatically acquires and displays the previous day's VLT data for all PoS, with all required fields present and correct in the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-060_DataFieldValidation_DashboardDisplay_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for a specific PoS after the daily data acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard loads and displays data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ADI Data Tab for the same PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ADI Data Tab is accessible and displays detailed data.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the fields IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, and Nr VLT Average (YTD) are displayed and match the expected values from the previous day's snapshot.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and values are accurate as per the latest data acquisition.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Daily data acquisition process has completed successfully.
2. Tester has access to ZENIT Dashboard and ADI Data Tab.
3. Known expected values for the selected PoS are available for comparison.
test_cases.Dataset: Known PoS with expected values for IdRice, ZonaRice, Nr VLT, Nr VLT Average (YTD).
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard and ADI Data Tab display all required fields with correct values for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-060_MissingDataHandling_ErrorScenario_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a scenario where NEXT VLT does not provide data for one or more PoS during the daily acquisition.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to acquire data and detects missing PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS for a PoS with missing data.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard indicates missing or unavailable data for the affected PoS (e.g., with an error message or placeholder).

Steps.Step Description: Check system logs or error notifications for records of the missing data event.
Steps.Expected Result: System logs or notifications clearly record the missing data incident for traceability.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Integration between ZENIT and NEXT VLT is active.
2. At least one PoS is configured in NEXT VLT to not provide data for the daily snapshot.
3. Tester has access to ZENIT Dashboard and system logs.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with intentionally missing data in NEXT VLT for the test date.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system gracefully handles missing PoS data, informs the user via the dashboard, and logs the incident for review.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error scenario for missing data.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-060_FieldBoundaryValidation_NrVLTAverage_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: In NEXT VLT, set up PoS data with boundary values for Nr VLT Average (e.g., 0, maximum allowed, negative, and non-integer values).
Steps.Expected Result: NEXT VLT contains PoS records with boundary and invalid values for Nr VLT Average.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the daily data acquisition process in ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT receives and processes the data from NEXT VLT.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS and ADI Data Tab for the affected PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the Nr VLT Average values as received or flags invalid data appropriately.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Integration between ZENIT and NEXT VLT is active.
2. PoS data with boundary and invalid values for Nr VLT Average is prepared in NEXT VLT.
3. Tester has access to ZENIT Dashboard.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS records in NEXT VLT with Nr VLT Average values: 0, maximum allowed, negative, non-integer.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT correctly displays valid boundary values and handles invalid values for Nr VLT Average according to system requirements (e.g., error message, data rejection, or correction).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Boundary and invalid value handling for Nr VLT Average field.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-060_AutomationOfDailyUpdate_Scheduling_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Verify the configuration of the daily scheduling job for data acquisition in ZENIT.
Steps.Expected Result: Scheduling job is configured to run once every 24 hours.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the scheduled time and observe the execution of the job.
Steps.Expected Result: Job executes automatically at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Check system logs to confirm the job ran and completed successfully.
Steps.Expected Result: Logs show successful execution and completion of the daily data acquisition job.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system is operational.
2. Daily scheduling job is configured.
3. Tester has access to system logs.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (relies on system configuration and logs).
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT's daily data acquisition job is scheduled and runs automatically every 24 hours, as confirmed by logs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers scheduling and automation aspect of daily update.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_DailyAutomatedIntegration_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the GESTORETE system has up-to-date data for all PoS as of the previous evening.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE contains the latest data for all PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled daily integration process between ZENIT and GESTORETE.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates automatically at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the data transfer from GESTORETE to ZENIT for all PoS records.
Steps.Expected Result: Data for all PoS is transferred from GESTORETE to ZENIT without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are received for each PoS: ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and populated for each PoS in ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the data snapshot in ZENIT reflects the previous evening's state from GESTORETE.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT displays a daily snapshot matching the previous evening's data from GESTORETE.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. GESTORETE system is operational and contains up-to-date PoS data as of the previous evening.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for integration with GESTORETE.
3. Scheduled daily integration job is configured and enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data in GESTORETE with all required fields populated for at least 3 PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system automatically acquires and stores a daily snapshot of all required PoS data fields from GESTORETE, reflecting the previous evening's state.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_DashboardSinglePoSDataDisplay_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure ZENIT has successfully acquired the latest daily data from GESTORETE for all PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains the most recent daily snapshot for each PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Single PoS' view for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard loads for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following fields are displayed: ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and populated with the correct values for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system has completed the daily data acquisition from GESTORETE.
2. Tester has access to the ZENIT Dashboard with permissions to view PoS data.
test_cases.Dataset: At least one PoS with known data values in ZENIT.
test_cases.Expected Result: The ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS view displays all required fields with accurate, up-to-date values for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_DashboardADIDataTabDisplay_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure ZENIT has the latest daily snapshot data for all PoS from GESTORETE.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains the most recent daily snapshot for each PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the ZENIT Dashboard and navigate to the 'Single PoS' view for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard loads for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'ADI Data' tab within the Single PoS dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'ADI Data' tab is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all required fields (ZonaRice, Nr AWP other dealer, NOIAG Credits, NOIAG Hopper, Keys AWP Drawer, Keys AWP Counter, Keys AWP Change Coins) are present and correctly populated.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are visible and display the correct values as per the latest daily snapshot.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT system has completed the daily data acquisition from GESTORETE.
2. Tester has access to the ZENIT Dashboard and the ADI Data tab for PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: At least one PoS with known data values in ZENIT, including ADI Data tab fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: The ZENIT Dashboard - Single PoS -- ADI Data Tab displays all required fields with accurate, up-to-date values for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_MissingFieldErrorHandling_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Configure GESTORETE to omit one or more required fields (e.g., NOIAG Credits) for a specific PoS in the daily data snapshot.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE contains incomplete data for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily integration process between ZENIT and GESTORETE.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates and attempts to transfer data.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the integration logs and ZENIT system for error handling related to missing fields.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT detects the missing field(s) and logs an appropriate error or warning message.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the incomplete PoS record is handled according to system requirements (e.g., flagged, not imported, or imported with null/default values).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT handles the incomplete record as specified, and the error is traceable in system logs.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. GESTORETE system is operational and can be configured to omit required fields for test purposes.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for integration with GESTORETE.
3. Scheduled daily integration job is configured and enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record in GESTORETE missing at least one required field (e.g., NOIAG Credits).
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT detects and logs missing required fields during daily data acquisition and handles incomplete records according to system requirements.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_InvalidFieldValueHandling_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Configure GESTORETE to provide an invalid value for a field (e.g., Keys AWP Drawer = 'INVALID_VALUE') for a specific PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE contains a PoS record with an invalid field value.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the daily integration process between ZENIT and GESTORETE.
Steps.Expected Result: The integration process initiates and attempts to transfer data.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the integration logs and ZENIT system for error handling related to invalid field values.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT detects the invalid value and logs an appropriate error or warning message.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the PoS record with the invalid value is handled according to system requirements (e.g., flagged, not imported, or imported with null/default values).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT handles the invalid record as specified, and the error is traceable in system logs.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. GESTORETE system is operational and can be configured to provide invalid field values for test purposes.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for integration with GESTORETE.
3. Scheduled daily integration job is configured and enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record in GESTORETE with at least one field set to an invalid value (e.g., Keys AWP Drawer = 'INVALID_VALUE').
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT detects and logs invalid field values during daily data acquisition and handles such records according to system requirements.

test_cases.Title: DailyDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-070_DailyAcquisitionFrequencyValidation_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the GESTORETE system updates PoS data at least once per day.
Steps.Expected Result: GESTORETE contains new data for PoS each day.

Steps.Step Description: Allow the ZENIT system to run the daily integration process for three consecutive days.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT performs daily data acquisition for three days.

Steps.Step Description: For each day, verify that ZENIT stores a new daily snapshot for each PoS, reflecting the previous evening's data.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT contains three distinct daily snapshots for each PoS, each corresponding to the correct date.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. GESTORETE system is operational and updates PoS data daily.
2. ZENIT system is operational and configured for daily integration.
3. Scheduled daily integration job is configured and enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS data in GESTORETE updated daily for at least three consecutive days.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT system acquires and stores a new daily snapshot for each PoS every day, with each snapshot reflecting the previous evening's data.

test_cases.Title: CervedDataAcquisition_proj080_Retrieve_CGS_and_ActivityStatus_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the Zenit system is connected to the Cerved system and the daily scheduled import flow is enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system is ready to retrieve data from Cerved.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the daily data acquisition flow (manually or wait for scheduled execution).
Steps.Expected Result: Data acquisition process starts.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for each active PoS, the system retrieves the CGS (Cerved Group Score) and Activity Status from Cerved.
Steps.Expected Result: CGS and Activity Status are retrieved for each active PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the retrieved data is stored in the Zenit system database.
Steps.Expected Result: Data is correctly stored and associated with the respective PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Zenit system is operational and connected to Cerved.
2. There are active PoS in the system (issued invoices in last 12 months).
3. Cerved system is available and contains up-to-date PoS data.
test_cases.Dataset: List of active PoS with known CGS and Activity Status in Cerved.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system successfully retrieves and stores CGS and Activity Status for each active PoS from Cerved.

test_cases.Title: CervedDataAcquisition_proj080_Log_And_Track_Cerved_Updates_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the daily data acquisition flow for Cerved data.
Steps.Expected Result: Data acquisition process starts.

Steps.Step Description: Introduce a change in Cerved data for a specific PoS (e.g., update CGS or Activity Status).
Steps.Expected Result: Change is present in Cerved system.

Steps.Step Description: Run the data acquisition flow again.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system detects the change.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the update is logged and tracked in the Zenit system (e.g., audit log, change history).
Steps.Expected Result: Update is logged with timestamp, PoS identifier, old and new values.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Zenit system is operational and connected to Cerved.
2. Logging and tracking mechanisms are enabled.
3. At least one PoS exists in both systems.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with modifiable CGS and Activity Status in Cerved.
test_cases.Expected Result: All updates to Cerved data are logged and tracked in Zenit with relevant details.

test_cases.Title: CervedDataAcquisition_proj080_Automatic_Daily_Scheduling_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: CervedDataAcquisition_proj080_ErrorHandling_CervedUnavailable_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: BorderoDataAcquisition_XPS-ZENIT-090_MissingFieldHandling_Valorizzatore_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: StatusCollection_XPS-ZENIT-102_AutomaticDataAcquisition_SAP_TEST_Backend

test_cases.Title: StatusCollection_XPS-ZENIT-102_BlockSeverityHierarchy_SAP_TEST_Backend

Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the change and prepares to send updated data.

Steps.Expected Result: Only the most severe block status is included in the data sent for the POS.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The system is integrated with SAP and block severity hierarchy is configured.
2. The POS has multiple block statuses assigned in SAP.
3. Tester can trigger open item status changes.
test_cases.Dataset: POS with multiple block statuses in SAP; block severity hierarchy defined.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system sends only the most serious block status for the POS, as per the defined hierarchy, upon status change.

test_cases.Title: WinningsMonitoring_XPSZENIT110_DWH_DailyDataAcquisition_Aggregation_SportTicketsPaidElsewhere_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure DWH has winnings data for sport tickets paid at other sales points for the current day, including all required fields.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH contains valid data for sport tickets paid at other sales points.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the Zenit system's daily data acquisition process at end-of-day.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit initiates data acquisition from DWH.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Zenit aggregates data based on seller PoS identifier, sell date, payment PoS identifier, and payment date.
Steps.Expected Result: Data is aggregated correctly according to the specified keys.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the extracted fields include Seller Agency Code, Seller PoS identifier, Competence Day, Cash Day, Winning Payment Day, Agency Code Payment, PoS Identifier of the payment, Amount bet, and Amount Won.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and correctly formatted in the aggregated data.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that Seller Agency Code and Agency Code Payment are 6-character strings left-padded with zeros, and for 'Corner' PoS, prefixed with 4-digit zone number and hyphen.
Steps.Expected Result: Codes are formatted as specified (e.g., 000045 or 0001-000045).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Seller PoS identifier and PoS Identifier of the payment are left-padded with zeros to match the required format (e.g., MI0001).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS identifiers are correctly formatted.

Steps.Step Description: Check that Competence Day, Cash Day, and Winning Payment Day are in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format.
Steps.Expected Result: Dates are correctly formatted.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the aggregated data with the DWH source to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Steps.Expected Result: Aggregated data matches DWH source data in content and totals.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH contains valid winnings monitoring data for sport tickets paid at other sales points for the test day.
2. Zenit system is operational and configured to acquire data from DWH.
3. Data extraction rules and formats are aligned with DWH specifications.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample DWH data for sport tickets paid at other sales points, including edge cases (e.g., 'Corner' PoS, various date formats, zero-padded codes).
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system acquires, aggregates, and formats winnings monitoring data for sport tickets paid at other sales points as per requirements, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and correct formatting.

test_cases.Title: WinningsMonitoring_XPSZENIT110_DWH_DailyDataAcquisition_FieldValidation_FormatAndEdgeCases_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare DWH data with edge cases: Seller Agency Code with and without 'Corner' prefix, PoS identifiers with varying lengths, date fields with invalid formats, and zero/negative amounts.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH contains data covering all edge cases.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger Zenit system's daily data acquisition process.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit initiates data acquisition from DWH.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Seller Agency Code is always a 6-character string left-padded with zeros, or for 'Corner' PoS, prefixed with 4-digit zone number and hyphen.
Steps.Expected Result: Codes are formatted as specified (e.g., 000045 or 0001-000045).

Steps.Step Description: Check that Seller PoS identifier and PoS Identifier of the payment are left-padded with zeros to match the required format (e.g., MI0001).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS identifiers are correctly formatted.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that all date fields are in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format and invalid dates are rejected or flagged.
Steps.Expected Result: Only valid date formats are accepted; invalid formats are handled appropriately.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that Amount bet and Amount Won are positive numbers and handle zero/negative values as per business rules.
Steps.Expected Result: Amounts are validated and any anomalies are flagged or handled as specified.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH contains winnings monitoring data with edge cases for all relevant fields.
2. Zenit system is operational and configured to acquire data from DWH.
test_cases.Dataset: DWH data with edge cases: 'Corner' PoS, invalid/valid date formats, zero/negative amounts, varying code lengths.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system validates and formats all fields according to requirements, handling edge cases and anomalies as specified.

test_cases.Title: ValidLogin-proj_001_Login_ValidCredentials_TEST_Android

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application on the Android device.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches successfully and displays the login screen.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username in the username field.
Steps.Expected Result: The username is accepted and displayed in the field.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid password in the password field.
Steps.Expected Result: The password is accepted and displayed as masked characters.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The application processes the credentials.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application response.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the home/dashboard screen.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The application is installed on the Android device.
2. The device is connected to the internet.
3. The user has a valid, active account.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password (e.g., user@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is logged in and redirected to the home/dashboard screen.

test_cases.Title: InvalidLogin-proj_001_Login_InvalidCredentials_TEST_Android

Steps.Expected Result: The username is accepted and displayed in the field.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid password in the password field.
Steps.Expected Result: The password is accepted and displayed as masked characters.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The application processes the credentials.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application response.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed indicating invalid credentials. User remains on the login screen.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The application is installed on the Android device.
2. The device is connected to the internet.
3. The user does not have an account or uses incorrect credentials.

test_cases.Title: Logout-proj_001_Logout_ValidSession_TEST_Android

test_cases.Title: SessionTimeoutLogout-proj_001_Logout_SessionTimeout_TEST_Android

test_cases.Title: LoginSuccess-XPSZENIT201_Login_SuccessfulAuthentication_DESKTOP_TEST

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page on a desktop browser.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT login screen is displayed with an 'Access' button.

Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Expected Result: Prompt for second factor authentication is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Approve the authentication request via the Authenticator App push notification OR enter a valid OTP from the Authenticator App.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication is processed by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the system to verify the second factor.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the ZENIT home page, with clear indication of the current environment (e.g., TEST). Access log is recorded.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is pre-configured in ZENIT with an enabled profile.
2. User has MFA and Authenticator App configured on their mobile device.
3. System is configured to support MFA.
4. User has access to a desktop computer and a supported browser.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid company username and password; Authenticator App with push/OTP enabled.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in, redirected to the home page with environment clearly shown, and access is logged for auditing.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_Inactivity_Logout_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction (mouse, keyboard, clicks, scrolling) for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected by the system for 5 minutes.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if a notification or pop-up warning about session expiration appears after 5 minutes of inactivity.
Steps.Expected Result: A notification or pop-up appears warning the user that the session will expire soon due to inactivity, possibly with a countdown timer.

Steps.Step Description: Do not interact with the system after the notification appears. Wait for the countdown to finish.
Steps.Expected Result: The system automatically logs out the user after the countdown expires.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's behavior after logout.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the login screen and cannot access any features without logging in again.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. No other active sessions for the same user on the same device.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user1/password1)
test_cases.Expected Result: The user is automatically logged out after 5 minutes of inactivity, receives a warning notification, and is redirected to the login screen. The disconnect event is logged in the system logs.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_Notification_ContinueSession_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Do not perform any interaction for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected by the system for 5 minutes.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if a notification or pop-up warning about session expiration appears.
Steps.Expected Result: A notification or pop-up appears warning the user that the session will expire soon due to inactivity, with a 'Continue' button.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Continue' button within the countdown period.
Steps.Expected Result: The session remains active, the notification disappears, and the user is not logged out.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. No other active sessions for the same user on the same device.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user1/password1)
test_cases.Expected Result: The user receives a session expiration notification after 5 minutes of inactivity and, upon clicking 'Continue', the session remains active without logout.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_ActiveInteraction_NoLogout_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Periodically interact with the system (e.g., move mouse, click, type) at intervals less than 5 minutes for a total duration of 10 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User activity is detected by the system during the session.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if any inactivity notification or automatic logout occurs during this period.
Steps.Expected Result: No inactivity notification or automatic logout occurs; the session remains active.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. No other active sessions for the same user on the same device.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user1/password1)
test_cases.Expected Result: As long as the user interacts with the system within the inactivity threshold, no logout or inactivity notification occurs.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_SessionLog_DisconnectEvent_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-XPSZENIT203_LoginTracking_RecordingOfUserAccess_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username and password credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials are accepted.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button to authenticate.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and granted access to the application.

Steps.Step Description: Query the secure database for the latest login record for the authenticated user.
Steps.Expected Result: A new login record is present in the database for the user.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the login record contains the following fields: Username, Surname and First Name, Email address, Title, Department, Date of Last Login, Status of the Username, Role.

test_cases.Expected Result: Upon successful login, a new record is created in the secure database containing all required user information fields as specified by SOX compliance.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive scenario for login tracking and field completeness.

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-XPSZENIT203_LoginTracking_RecordingWithMissingProfileFields_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-XPSZENIT203_LoginTracking_AccessControlToLoginRecords_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the login tracking records or database directly or via application interface.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to login tracking records is denied. User receives an appropriate error or access denied message.

Steps.Step Description: Logout and login as an authorized personnel (e.g., compliance officer or admin).
Steps.Expected Result: Authorized user is authenticated and granted access to application features.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the login tracking records or database via the authorized interface.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to login tracking records is granted. Authorized user can view the records as per their permissions.

1. At least two user accounts exist: one regular user and one authorized personnel (e.g., compliance officer).
2. Application is installed and accessible on the desktop device.
3. Database contains login tracking records.
4. Access control mechanisms are configured as per SOX requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Regular user credentials (e.g., username: user1, password: Pass@123), authorized personnel credentials (e.g., username: admin1, password: Admin@123).
test_cases.Expected Result: Only authorized personnel can access login tracking records; regular users are denied access as per SOX compliance.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers access control and security of login tracking records.

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-XPSZENIT203_LoginTracking_RecordingOfFailedLoginAttempts_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: Application launches successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username with an incorrect password.
Steps.Expected Result: Login attempt is rejected with an error message.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat the failed login attempt multiple times (e.g., 3 times).
Steps.Expected Result: Each failed attempt is rejected with an error message.

Steps.Step Description: Query the secure database for login tracking records related to the attempted username.
Steps.Expected Result: Failed login attempts are recorded in the database with appropriate status (e.g., 'Failed', 'Invalid Credentials').

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the failed login record contains the required fields (where applicable) and the status reflects the failed attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Login tracking record for failed attempts includes Username, Date/Time, and Status indicating failure.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists for the attempted username.
2. Tester has access to the secure database for verification.
3. Application is installed and accessible on the desktop device.
4. Database is operational and reachable from the test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username (e.g., username: johndoe), invalid password (e.g., WrongPass@123).
test_cases.Expected Result: Failed login attempts are recorded in the database with status indicating failure and relevant user information where available.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for login tracking and failure status recording.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentUpdate_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_DataConsistency_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A updates a field in the data record but does not save yet.
Steps.Expected Result: User A sees the updated value in the edit form.

Steps.Step Description: User B updates the same field in the data record and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User B's changes are saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User A attempts to save their changes to the same field.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the concurrency conflict and notifies User A, preventing data overwrite or prompting for conflict resolution.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. At least two valid user accounts exist (User A and User B).
3. Shared data record is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents data loss or inconsistency by detecting and managing concurrent updates, ensuring data integrity.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent update scenario for a single data field.

test_cases.Title: SimultaneousRead_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_ReadConsistency_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A updates a field in the data record and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User A's changes are saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User B refreshes the data record view.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the updated value reflecting User A's changes, ensuring read consistency.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. At least two valid user accounts exist (User A and User B).
3. Shared data record is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: System ensures that all users see the most recent committed data, maintaining consistency across sessions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers read consistency after concurrent update.

test_cases.Title: SimultaneousCreate_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_CreateConflict_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and initiates creation of a new record with a unique identifier (e.g., 'Record123').
Steps.Expected Result: User A is presented with the record creation form.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and initiates creation of a new record with the same unique identifier ('Record123').
Steps.Expected Result: User B is presented with the record creation form.

Steps.Step Description: User A completes the form and saves the new record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A's record is created successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User B completes the form and attempts to save the new record with the same identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the duplicate identifier and prevents User B from creating the record, displaying an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. At least two valid user accounts exist (User A and User B).
3. No existing record with identifier 'Record123'.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; unique identifier 'Record123'.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents creation of duplicate records, ensuring data integrity under concurrent creation attempts.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent creation with unique constraint enforcement.

test_cases.Title: SimultaneousDelete_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_DeleteConflict_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A deletes the data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A receives confirmation that the record has been deleted.

Steps.Step Description: User B attempts to update or delete the same record after User A's deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: System notifies User B that the record no longer exists and prevents the operation.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. At least two valid user accounts exist (User A and User B).
3. Shared data record is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents operations on deleted records, ensuring data consistency and integrity.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent delete and update scenarios.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentSession_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_SessionIsolation_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and performs an operation (e.g., updates a record).
Steps.Expected Result: User A's operation is completed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and performs a different operation (e.g., creates a new record).
Steps.Expected Result: User B's operation is completed successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that User A's session and data are not affected by User B's actions, and vice versa.
Steps.Expected Result: Each user's operations are isolated, and no unintended interference occurs between sessions.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. At least two valid user accounts exist (User A and User B).
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; sample data for operations.
test_cases.Expected Result: System maintains session isolation, ensuring that concurrent users do not interfere with each other's operations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers session isolation under concurrent usage.

test_cases.Title: CreditManagement-XPS330_CreditLineFieldsCalculation_Dashboard_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Dashboard application as a user with access to PoS details.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the list of PoS and select a PoS with at least one credit line configured.
Steps.Expected Result: The details page for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: In the 'Credit Management' section, identify a credit line with known Base Amount and Extension Amount values.
Steps.Expected Result: A credit line with known values is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Total' value equals the sum of 'Base Amount' and 'Extension Amount'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Total' = 'Base Amount' + 'Extension Amount'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the '% Consumed' value equals ('Consumed' / 'Total') * 100, formatted as a percentage.
Steps.Expected Result: '% Consumed' is correctly calculated and displayed as a percentage.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Residue' value equals 'Total' minus 'Consumed'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Residue' = 'Total' - 'Consumed'.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with valid credentials and access to PoS details.
2. At least one PoS exists with at least one credit line with known values for Base, Extension, and Consumed.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, PoS with credit line having known Base, Extension, and Consumed values.
test_cases.Expected Result: All calculated fields (Total, % Consumed, Residue) are accurate for each credit line/product.

test_cases.Title: BusinessData-XPS375_CornerCalculatedFieldsValidation_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit Dashboard as a user with access to a PoS of type 'Corner'.

Steps.Expected Result: Calculated fields display values consistent with the formulas: BC Year Projection = (Business Contribution (YTD) / <Previous Months>) * 12; Decile = BC Year Projection / 10; Exposure Risk = Current year medium border * 1.8.

2. At least one PoS of type 'Corner' with all necessary data for calculated fields.

test_cases.Expected Result: Calculated fields are present and their values match the expected results based on the provided formulas.

Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Corner Credit Situation' option.
Steps.Expected Result: The import interface for Corner Credit Situation is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Upload' button and select an Excel file that is missing required fields (e.g., missing Zona Code or Rice Number for some rows).
Steps.Expected Result: The system rejects the file and displays a validation error message indicating missing required fields.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the ZENIT system.
2. An Excel file with missing required fields is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Excel file missing required fields (e.g., Zona Code or Rice Number).
test_cases.Expected Result: The system does not import the file and provides a clear error message about missing required fields.

test_cases.Title: ImportCornerCreditSituation-proj_537_import_viewDashboardUpdate_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' for a PoS that will be updated by the import.
Steps.Expected Result: Current Corner Credit Situation data is displayed for the selected PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section and select 'Import Corner Credit Situation'.
Steps.Expected Result: The import interface for Corner Credit Situation is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Upload a valid Excel file containing updated data for the selected PoS and confirm the import.
Steps.Expected Result: The system processes the file and displays a success message.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' for the same PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The dashboard displays the updated Corner Credit Situation data as per the imported file.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the ZENIT system.
2. The PoS to be updated exists in the system.
3. A valid Excel file with updated data for the PoS is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; Existing PoS; Valid Excel file with updated data for the PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: The dashboard reflects the updated Corner Credit Situation data after import.

test_cases.Title: ImportContiGiocoCreditSituation_XPS-ZENIT-538_ValidExcelImport_MassiveImporter_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Massive Importer' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Massive Importer' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Import Conti Gioco Credit Situation' option.
Steps.Expected Result: File upload interface for 'Import Conti Gioco Credit Situation' is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Choose File' button and select a valid Excel file filled according to the provided template, containing correct Zona Code and Rice Number data.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected file is attached and ready for upload.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Upload' button to start the import process.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file and displays a success message indicating that the import was successful.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Dashboard - Single PoS - Credit Management' section and search for a PoS included in the imported file.
Steps.Expected Result: The credit situation data for the selected PoS is updated and matches the imported values.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the ZENIT system.
2. The standard Excel template for 'Conti Gioco Credit Situation' is available and correctly filled with valid data.
3. The user has access to the 'Massive Importer' section.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid Excel file with correct Zona Code, Rice Number, and credit data for at least one PoS.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system successfully imports the data, updates the credit situation for each PoS, and displays the updated data in the dashboard.

test_cases.Expected Result: The SIMP Credit Situation data is imported successfully and visible in the dashboard for each corresponding PoS.

test_cases.Title: VerifyExecution_proj_001_Back-EndProcedure_API_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the back-end procedure via the designated API endpoint or scheduled job.
Steps.Expected Result: The back-end procedure is initiated without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the execution logs or status response for the procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: Logs/status indicate successful execution of the procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that all expected data manipulations or outputs (e.g., database updates, file generation) have occurred as per the procedure's specification.
Steps.Expected Result: All data manipulations or outputs are present and correct according to the requirements.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The back-end environment is deployed and accessible.
2. The procedure to be tested is implemented and available.
3. Test data is present in the database as required for the procedure.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample input data in the database relevant to the procedure.
test_cases.Expected Result: The back-end procedure executes successfully, performing all intended operations and producing correct outputs without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers successful execution and output validation of the back-end procedure.

test_cases.Title: ErrorHandling_proj_001_Back-EndProcedure_InvalidInput_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the back-end procedure with invalid or malformed input data (e.g., missing required fields, incorrect data types).
Steps.Expected Result: The procedure detects the invalid input and does not proceed with execution.

Steps.Step Description: Check the error logs or API response for error messages.
Steps.Expected Result: Appropriate error messages are logged or returned, indicating the nature of the input error.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The back-end environment is deployed and accessible.
2. The procedure to be tested is implemented and available.
test_cases.Dataset: Malformed or incomplete input data for the procedure.
test_cases.Expected Result: The back-end procedure gracefully handles invalid input by not executing and providing clear error feedback.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for invalid input scenarios.

test_cases.Title: BoundaryCondition_proj_001_Back-EndProcedure_LargeDataset_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a large dataset at the upper boundary of expected input size in the database.
Steps.Expected Result: Dataset is prepared and accessible by the back-end procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the back-end procedure to process the large dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: The procedure starts processing the dataset without immediate failure.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the execution for completion and check for performance degradation or errors.
Steps.Expected Result: The procedure completes successfully within acceptable time limits and without errors.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The back-end environment is deployed and accessible.
2. The procedure to be tested is implemented and available.
3. A large dataset is prepared in the database.
test_cases.Dataset: Large volume of input data at the upper boundary of expected size.
test_cases.Expected Result: The back-end procedure processes large datasets efficiently and without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers boundary and performance aspects for large input data.

test_cases.Title: Security_proj_001_Back-EndProcedure_UnauthorizedAccess_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to trigger the back-end procedure using invalid or unauthorized credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: The system denies access to the procedure.

Steps.Step Description: Check the response or logs for security-related error messages.
Steps.Expected Result: Appropriate security error messages are logged or returned, and no procedure execution occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The back-end environment is deployed and accessible.
2. The procedure to be tested is implemented and available.
3. User account with insufficient privileges is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or unauthorized user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthorized users cannot execute the back-end procedure, and security is enforced.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers security and access control for the back-end procedure.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-proj_600_DailySnapshot_Scheduling_BACKEND_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the daily snapshot job is scheduled to run at the configured nightly time.
Steps.Expected Result: The daily snapshot job is present in the scheduler with the correct time configuration.

Steps.Step Description: Allow the scheduled time to pass and monitor the execution of the snapshot job.
Steps.Expected Result: The snapshot job executes at the scheduled time without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Check the storage location for the presence of a new snapshot labeled with the current date and time.
Steps.Expected Result: A new snapshot file/folder is created with the correct date and time label.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System time is correctly set.
2. Scheduler service is running.
3. Sufficient storage space is available.
test_cases.Dataset: System configuration for scheduling, access to storage location.
test_cases.Expected Result: A daily snapshot is automatically created at the scheduled time, labeled with the correct date and time.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers scheduling and execution of daily snapshot only.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-proj_600_ClosedPoS_DataDeletion_BACKEND_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Identify PoS records marked as closed and not active for a period exceeding the configured retention (e.g., 10 years).
Steps.Expected Result: A list of eligible PoS records for deletion is generated.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that PoS under legal management or with loss transitions in recent years are excluded from deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS under legal management or with recent loss transitions are not included in the deletion list.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data deletion process for eligible PoS records.
Steps.Expected Result: Only eligible PoS records are deleted from the storage.

Steps.Step Description: Check that deleted PoS data is no longer retrievable from the system.
Steps.Expected Result: Deleted PoS data cannot be accessed or restored via standard retrieval functions.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System contains PoS records with various statuses and closure dates.
2. Legal management and loss transition flags are set appropriately.
3. Retention period is configured (e.g., 10 years).
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS records with different statuses, closure dates, and legal/loss flags.
test_cases.Expected Result: Data for closed PoS exceeding the retention period is deleted, except for those under legal management or with recent loss transitions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on data deletion logic for closed PoS.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-proj_600_TemporaryLogicalClosurePoS_BACKEND_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Mark a PoS as temporarily logically closed for a configurable period.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS status is updated to 'temporarily closed' and the closure period is set.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to display the temporarily closed PoS in the user interface or data retrieval API.
Steps.Expected Result: The PoS is not displayed or retrievable during the logical closure period.

Steps.Step Description: After the logical closure period expires, check if the PoS is eligible for permanent deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS becomes eligible for permanent deletion after the logical closure period.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. PoS exists in the system.
2. Logical closure period is configured.
3. User has permission to update PoS status.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record eligible for logical closure.
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS is hidden during logical closure and becomes eligible for deletion after the period expires.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers logical closure and subsequent eligibility for deletion.
